# Request for Proposal - Offsite Records Storage - Department of Justice Canada
### Reference Information

* Reference Number: cb-33-37957483
* Amendment Number: 5
* Solicitation Number: 1000031051-04
* Publication Date: 2024-01-22
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-03-25 14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2024-03-25

### Request Details

The Department of Justice Canada (JUS) is seeking a Managed Services Provider (MSP) to store its paper-based records inventory and provide records management services. The MSP must ensure the safekeeping of the JUS paper records inventory, which includes documents such as legal case files, consultations, agreements, and corporate records.

The JUS collects and creates physical records holdings under its mandate to administer justice under federal law. The records are managed according to the related legislation and must be retained and disposed of according to the retention and disposition scheduling requirements.

### Key Requirements

* The MSP must be able to store the JUS paper records inventory until their retention periods are met.
* The JUS may need to retrieve files back to its offices in order to meet operational requirements.
* Once closed files have met their retention periods and have received approval for disposition, JUS must be able to permanently withdraw the files from the MSP inventory.
* Security requirements are associated with this requirement, and bidders should refer to Part 6 - Security, Financial and Other Requirements.

### Contract Details

* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-04-01
* Expected Contract End Date: 2029-03-31
* Option to extend by five (5) additional one (1) year option periods.

### Submission Requirements

Submission should include:
* Detailed proposal outlining the MSP's qualifications, experience, and methodology for storing and managing the JUS paper records inventory.
* Pricing schedule based on the Technical Requirements outlined in the contract.
* Proof of business registration and proof of insurance papers.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Jeff Williams at jeff.williams@justice.gc.ca or (236) 335-2084.

Attachments are available on the Canada Buys website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://)
